result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on October 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Taylor R Lee in court. 
Defendant waives reading of the complaint and his/her right to be represented by counsel. Rights explained.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury calendar. 
Prints ordered to MTPD
Offer deadline 08-05-2022
Further proceedings scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:29 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Taylor R Lee
Current: 516 N. 9th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 410 Riverview Dr, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-10-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery-dvo and disorderly conduct-dvo.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 06-30-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $750.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he provide an address to the Clerk of Court office, in writing, within 24 hours of release, that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and that he have no assaultive contact with D.D. and H.E.-D.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
